column4: I did an initial install of ubuntu, then installed kubuntu-desktop, now I wish to remove ubuntu-desktop and all gnome apps possible without breaking my system.  I looked in the forums and it suggested sudo apt-get remove --purge ubuntu-desktop, but it only removed ubuntu-desktop; no other packages.  Any advice is appreciated...???
So you are just trying to get rid of any packages gnome installed?
So why not just search your installed packages in synatpic?
If you removed ubuntu-desktop, it should technically remove all associated packages.
